S.FORM: hərkəjit libaŋlɛ biha cogu'llɛ — khunɛ biha cogu'llɛ kumba əghi s'yɛaŋ kɔ kumma rɔt wayɛ.
S.TRANSL: When Harka Jit Libang got married — when he married, his father had already died, he had only his mother.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ waruma mɛtmuna jəgga'tmu dhənsili mɛtmuna'llɛ kusa mɛnchuma thik təmər khola liŋghim mɛdeˀruaŋ yuŋɛ — waru mahili mɛtmunam'ɛn.
S.TRANSL: At that time in a place called Waruma [near Libang] — the daughter of a certain Dhansiri — one they called Waru Mahili — had been married in Linkhim in the Tamar valley.

S.FORM: khɔllɛ kuɔŋɛːkma mahilin cum yuːru.
S.TRANSL: [When she came back to Waruma on a visit] she brought down her husband's younger sister as a companion .

S.FORM: cum yuːruaŋ kɔ hatthaŋ waruma y'yɛsiaŋ wayɛsi'llɛ kɔ hərkəjit libaŋlɛ kummarɛ kɔ nisusi.
S.TRANSL: She had brought down a companion, and they had come down to Waruma [above Libang] and there Harka Jit Libang's mother saw them.

S.FORM: nisusiaŋ kɔ "ləu! sarik numa cok keʈin."
S.TRANSL: She saw them and said "Well, the girl is very good-looking."

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ "biha mɛtm'ɛllɛ nuˀi?" phɛaŋ khunchi — waru mahilinu hərkəjit libaŋlɛ kummannu — hɛnamuyɛsi.
S.TRANSL: Then, wondering if it would be a good match, they — Waru Maili together with Harka Jit Libang's mother — discussed it.

S.FORM: hɛna muyɛsi'llɛ kɔ — hɛna muyɛsi'llɛ kɔ "ləu! iŋga — nepali'tmu kuʈuni mɛmɛttu — iŋga kuʈuni kɛbia kɔrɔ keʈi coguŋ piniŋ" mɛttusi waru mahili'llɛ.
S.TRANSL: They discussed it and — in Nepali they call it "kutuni" [matchmaker's fee] — "Well! If you'll give me the matchmaker's fee, I'll fix up the girl for you all," Waru Mahili told them.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ — waru mahili'llɛaŋ kunchoˀmit kɛdama hərkəjit libaŋlɛ kumma kɔ — khɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ — "ok" —
S.TRANSL: Then Harka Jit Libang's mother, who was a remote in-law of Waru Mahili's [being married to an elder member of WM's clan] said "All right."

S.FORM: iŋga biha cogaŋŋɛllɛ təmər khola liŋghim kɛyuŋma keʈi thik waru mahilirɛ cum yuːruaŋ wayɛ.
S.TRANSL: [After an interruption, the narrator begins again in the first person.] When I got married, Waru Mahili had brought a girl from Linkhim in the Tamar Khola down as a companion.

S.FORM: cum yuːruaŋ wayɛ'llɛ kɔ yaˀ raːksɛ pegaŋ.
S.TRANSL: When she had brought her down, I went to paddy-dance.

S.FORM: yaˀ raːksɛ pegaŋŋɛllɛ yaˀ raːktɛsigɛ palam mɛtnɛsigɛ.
S.TRANSL: I went and we two paddy-danced and sang.

S.FORM: yaˀ raːktɛsigɛ'llɛ kɔ khunɛaŋ palam mɛttaŋ iŋgaŋ mɛttuŋ, palam.
S.TRANSL: While we were paddy-dancing, she sang to me and I sang to her.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kudaːndiks'ma kɔ — kudaːndiks'ma kɔ yaŋnaŋ ammarɛ sen dosaŋ
S.TRANSL: Then the next day my mother asked me,

S.FORM: "ləu! hatthaŋnu keʈi thik y'yɛaŋ waˀ pha khɛpsumbɛ. yaˀ mu kɛlaːksi.
S.TRANSL: "Well, we heard that a girl has come up there, and you two danced paddy together.

S.FORM: kɛsira thaŋ kɔrɔ yuːtmaŋ khɛnɛ'tmu biha mɛtma" ammarɛ mɛttaŋ.
S.TRANSL: If you like her, we'll bring her down and marry her to you," my mother said to me.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ "iŋga asira thaŋ. numa cok keʈin" lɔˀraŋaŋ amma mɛttuŋ.
S.TRANSL: "I like her. The girl is nice," I told my mother.

S.FORM: mɛttuŋŋɛllɛ ammarɛ ambhɔŋasi andumbasi ambhusi an'saˀsi jəmmə paŋbhe'tmu kɛyuŋba jəmmə phuksusiaŋ kɔ
S.TRANSL: When I said that my mother gathered my paternal uncles, older and younger, and my brothers and cousins, all who stayed in the village,

S.FORM: "khunɛ khɔmbha paːttu mɔtta'llɛ" lɔˀrɛaŋ kɔ phuksusi.
S.TRANSL: saying "Motta says all right," she got them together.

S.FORM: khas gəri iŋga amiŋ kɔ mɔtta rɔt mɛːndu, hərkəjit iŋga amiŋ kɔ.
S.TRANSL: Actually my name isn't just Motta, it's Harka Jit.

S.FORM: phuksusi'llɛ kɔ "ləu! kɛsira thaŋŋi mɛːnni?" phɛaŋ yammu iŋga sen mɛdosaŋ.
S.TRANSL: She got them together and they asked me again, "OK, you like her, right?"

S.FORM: sen mɛdosaŋŋɛllɛ "iŋga asira thaŋ" mɛttuŋsiŋ.
S.TRANSL: They asked me and I told them, "Yes, I like her."

S.FORM: "iŋga asira thaŋ" mɛttuŋsiŋŋaŋ kɔ jəmmə anigɛ kak cupsigɛaŋ kɔ peigɛaŋ sen tosumbɛ waru mahili mɛtmunan dhənsili'llɛ kusa.
S.TRANSL: When I told them that, we all got together and went and asked her — Waru Mahili asked Dhansiri's daughter.

S.FORM: sen tosumbɛ'llɛ kɔ "iŋga kɔ amba ni mɛwaˀ ammani mɛwaˀ ambhu an'saˀ mɛwaˀ.
S.TRANSL: When we asked her [she said] "I have my father and my mother and my brothers.

S.FORM: khɛni lamdzɔŋ laːtma aŋgɛŋghonɛn.
S.TRANSL: You don't get to just elope with me.

S.FORM: ahimdho pegi. thaŋŋinnɛ!" phɛaŋ
S.TRANSL: Let's go up to my house. Come on up!"

S.FORM: təmər khola liŋghim kɛyuŋma asmatim'ɛllɛ khɔmbhɔ mɛttusi.
S.TRANSL: she told them, Asmati who lived in Linkhim in the Tamur Khola.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ "ɛtyo kɛyaːksaŋ nuˀ pha.
S.TRANSL: "It's best if you stay down here, we're telling you.

S.FORM: kɛmba kɛmma pəisa huˀma thi sa phak'hɔk huˀma poŋ" phɛaŋ mɛmɛttu "paŋbhe'tmu".
S.TRANSL: We have to take money and beer and meat and a pig to your parents," they said, "in the village."

S.FORM: iŋga ambhɔŋa andumbasirɛ ammasirɛ mɛbeaŋ mɛmɛttu.
S.TRANSL: My uncles and aunts went and told her.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ keʈin mɛdɛndɛn.
S.TRANSL: But the girl didn't agree.

S.FORM: mɛdɛndɛnnɛllɛ kɔ waru mahili mɛtmunab'ɛn kɔ khunɛ naːktu kɛsembadzi.
S.TRANSL: When she didn't agree, Waru Mahili asked for a little money.

S.FORM: naːktu'llɛ kɔ khunɛ pəccasthe yaŋ ammarɛ puru.
S.TRANSL: My mother gave her 50 rupees.

S.FORM: puru'llɛ kɔ "ləu! iŋga cokma pima sukniŋ alla hɔmbhɔgɔrɔ" lɔˀrɛaŋ khunɛ kuɔŋɛːkm'ɛn mɛttu.
S.TRANSL: "OK, now I can fix it up for you," said her husband's junior clan-member [i.e. Waru Maili, to HJ's mother].

S.FORM: "ləu! ɛyarikpa mɔnahaˀ'tmu khɛnɛ kɛyaːkɛllɛ, kɛyuŋɛllɛ nuˀ.
S.TRANSL: "Staying and living with people who are so important is a good thing.

S.FORM: jəgga nɛ — khambek nɛ" mɛttu "khambek nɛ. khɛnɛ dukhəi kɛndzanɛn" mɛttu.
S.TRANSL: There's land. You won't be in need," she said,

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ lɛmu khunɛ.
S.TRANSL: She coaxed her.

S.FORM: khɔmbhasaŋ keʈin kɔ mɛdɛndɛn.
S.TRANSL: Even so, the girl didn't agree.

S.FORM: "iŋga amba amma kɛwaˀbaa niba.
S.TRANSL: "I am someone who has parents!

S.FORM: iŋga tho pekŋa amba ammarɛ'tmu. ɛmbha khɛni tho thaŋinnɛ!
S.TRANSL: I'm going up to my parents' place. You all just come on up!

S.FORM: ɛmbha amba amma mɛttamsimmɛaŋ amba amma mɛdɛn kɔrɔ iŋga tɛnna" lɔˀrɛ.
S.TRANSL: You talk to my father and mother, and if they agree, I agree," she said.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ yammu mɛmɛttusi paŋbhe'tmu ambhɔŋasi andumbasirɛ
S.TRANSL: Then my uncles from the village said,

S.FORM: "ɛtyonu biha dzokmaŋ khɛnɛ tho pekmaŋ kɛmba kɛmmaŋ mɛtmasi.
S.TRANSL: "Get married down here and then go up and tell your parents.

S.FORM: kɛmba kɛmmarɛ akkh'yarik mɛbaːttu khɔn jəmmə pəisa pima suktumbɛ anigɛ" phɛaŋ mɛmɛttu'llɛ kɔ
S.TRANSL: However much your parents say, we can give them the money in full," they said,

S.FORM: keʈin mɛdɛndɛn. mɛdɛndɛnaŋ kɔ aphna khunɛ — kunnɛ thik yuŋɛ — kulluŋwama — tarbare mɛmɛttub'ɛllɛ kuhimdaŋma — khɔtmu kɔ khunɛ loktɛaŋ pe.
S.TRANSL: but the girl didn't agree. There was one of her relatives [in the village] — an older sister — her cousin on her mother's side — Tarbare' wife — she ran away down there.

S.FORM: loktɛ pe'llɛ gɔ naːttumbɛrɔ teˀrumbɛ kaklɛ.
S.TRANSL: She ran away and we all chased after her.

S.FORM: naːttumbɛrɔ teˀrumbɛ'llɛ mu kulluŋwam'ɛllɛ kuhimmu lasɛaŋ kɔ mɛlɔːndɛn.
S.TRANSL: When we chased after her she went into her cousin's house and didn't come out.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ lamdhettɛtmu yohaŋ lamdhettɛtmu yuŋigɛ. kohi thohaŋ lamdhettɛtmu yuŋigɛ kohi nahaŋ lamdhettɛtmu yuŋigɛ.
S.TRANSL: So we sat at the downhill door. Some of us stayed at the door on the uphill side and some stayed over at the front door.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ yammu bihallɛ paːnnɛn paːttumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: Again we talked of the marriage.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ keʈi lɔːndɛaŋ loktɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then the girl came out and ran off.

S.FORM: loktɛ'llɛ kɔ cisɔŋmaŋ loktɛ.
S.TRANSL: She ran a little way downhill.

S.FORM: ŋasi tuksirɛ naːttumbɛrɔ teˀrumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: Five or six of us chased after her.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛ yo peigɛaŋ kɔ tɛmsumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: We went down and caught her.

S.FORM: pəhile iŋga tɛmsuŋ.
S.TRANSL: First I caught her.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ aegaŋ adɔgaŋ — kuegaŋ kudɔgaŋ jəmmə mɛd'yɛaŋ khunchiaŋ mɛdɛmsu.
S.TRANSL: Then behind me and in front of me — behind her and in front of her they all came down too and held her.

S.FORM: mɛdɛmsuaŋ kɔ thaktumbɛ ɛttho kulluŋwam'ɛllɛ kuhimmu.
S.TRANSL: They caught her and brought her back up here to her cousin's house.

S.FORM: thaktumbɛaŋ khunɛ khɔmbhɔ "agɛdɛm agɛuːŋ phɔgɔrɔ khɛni taːrammɛ ləu! kɛsukpaniŋ phɔgɔrɔ.
S.TRANSL: When they brought her up, she said, "Since you're holding me and dragging me off, bring it [the bride-price], if you're able!

S.FORM: pəisa taːrammɛ! samm'yaŋ taːrammɛ!" lɔˀrɛ.
S.TRANSL: Bring the money! Bring the gold!" she said.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ samm'yaŋ ɖhuŋgri thik taːrumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then we brought a gold earring.

S.FORM: pəisa dui səi yaŋ taːrumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: We brought 200 rupees.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ mɛdɛndɛnchaŋ tɛndɛrɔ cokmunaŋ thakmuna.
S.TRANSL: Even though she didn't agree, we made her agree and brought her up.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ thaktumbɛaŋ biha mɛttumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: We brought her up here and performed the marriage.

S.FORM: biha mɛttumbɛaŋ kɔ tin car dinlɛ yok thɔkwa mɛy'yɛ.
S.TRANSL: Three or four days after we performed the marriage some trackers came down [from the girl's village].

S.FORM: yok mɛdhɔktu.
S.TRANSL: They traced her.

S.FORM: yok thɔkwa y'yɛaŋ kɔ bihasaraŋŋɛn kɛsab'ɛnnu mɛdumɛsinnaŋ yok thɔkwa ɛtyo lɔːndɛ.
S.TRANSL: When the tracker came down, he turned up without having met the marriage-offering deliverers [who were on their way up to the girl's village] on the way.

S.FORM: biha saraŋ kɛsab'ɛn tho təmər khola liŋghim lɔːndɛ.
S.TRANSL: The marriage-offering deliverers came out up in Linkhim, in the Tamur Khola.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ yok thɔkwa'llɛ y'yɛaŋ kɔ phudoŋ purumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: The tracker came down and we offered him hospitality.

S.FORM: phudoŋ purumbɛaŋ yusik kɛrɛb'ɛn bihandik nuːksɛ pe.
S.TRANSL: We received him, and after arriving in the evening he went back in the morning.

S.FORM: yaŋ tho nuːksɛ pe.
S.TRANSL: He went back again.

S.FORM: yok thɔkwan tho kɛrɛaŋ khunɛ mɛttusi
S.TRANSL: When the tracker arrived up there he told them,

S.FORM: "ləu, kɛsan kɔ yo ni khɔmbha biha mɛmɛttu rətchə libaŋ tumyaŋhaŋlɛ kɔ" phɛaŋ
S.TRANSL: "They have married your daughter down there, the Libang subba's family,"

S.FORM: tho yok thɔkwa'llɛ mɛttu təmər khola liŋghim keʈi'llɛ kumba.
S.TRANSL: the tracker told the girl's father up there in Linkhim, in the Tamur Khola.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ ɔːktɛ pindɛ laːksɛ kumban kɔ.
S.TRANSL: Her father shouted, he jumped, he danced.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ yammu ɛtyonu bihasaraŋ sasɛ kɛbekp'ɛn kɔ khɔllɛaŋ khɛpsu.
S.TRANSL: The one who had gone up from down here to deliver the offering heard it too.

S.FORM: bihasaraŋŋɛn mɛdzonɛn.
S.TRANSL: He didn't eat the marriage-offering [a leg of pork].

S.FORM: lap tesu.
S.TRANSL: He threw it out.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ lap tesu'llɛ kɔ kumbhu kun'saˀ jəmmə mɛdzupsɛaŋ khunchi mɛghɔktuaŋ mɛdzo mu.
S.TRANSL: When he threw it out, his brothers all got together and carved it up and ate it.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ yammu kha bihasaraŋ kɛsab'ɛn kɔ nuːksɛaŋ y'yɛ'llɛ
S.TRANSL: So when the marriage-offering deliverer came back down

S.FORM: "abhe abhe poksɛ kɔ?" phɛaŋ ɛtyo hərkəjitlɛ kummarɛ hərkəjitlɛ jəmmə kumbhɔŋasirɛ mɛyuŋsiŋŋaŋ sen mɛdosu'llɛ
S.TRANSL: "How was it?" asked Harka Jit's mother and all his uncles.

S.FORM: "ɛm— ɔːktɛ kappob'ɛn ɛmbha keʈillɛ kumban kɔ ɔːktɛ pindɛ.
S.TRANSL: "The old man shouted — the girl's father shouted and jumped around,

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ yammu bihasaraŋŋɛnnaŋ mɛdzonɛn.
S.TRANSL: and he didn't eat the offering.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ kɔ kumbhu kun'saˀ mɛdzupsɛaŋ bihasaraŋŋɛn co — mɛdzo" lɔˀrik khunɛ ɛmbha paːttu'llɛ kɔ
S.TRANSL: Then his brothers got together and they ate the offering — they ate it," he told them.

S.FORM: ɛtyo "alla abhe cokma?" phɛaŋ kɔ yammu khunchi cumluŋ mɛdzogɛ.
S.TRANSL: They held a council down here to decide what to do next.

S.FORM: cumluŋ mɛdzogɛ'llɛ kɔ "ləu alla ɛtyonu keʈi lɛmmaŋ kɔ khɔmbhɛaŋ pekma" phɛaŋ
S.TRANSL: "Well, now we'll persuade the girl and then go [up to the girl's village],

S.FORM: "ɛtyonu kundumba kumbhɔŋanu kummanu."
S.TRANSL: from down here together with his uncles and his mother.

S.FORM: ammanu ambhɔŋa andumbasi səllah mɛdzogɛaŋ yammu pegigɛ.
S.TRANSL: My uncles took counsel with my mother and we went.

S.FORM: carkələmɛtmu pekmuna'llɛ "ləu! khɛnɛ — khɛni libaŋ tumyaŋhaŋb'ɛllɛ asan rajile kɛlaːrummi birajile kɛlaːrum?" phɛaŋ kɔ ɔːktɛ phiːktɛ
S.TRANSL: When we went with the marriage-gifts [Nep. car kalam], "Well you Libang chiefs — did you take my daughter willingly or against her will?" he shouted and screeched.

S.FORM: na kusan "sen tosuŋ" phɛaŋ kusan hɔksu.
S.TRANSL: He looked for his daughter to ask her.

S.FORM: tərə kusan kɔ kumbhɔŋarɛ kuhimmu peaŋ yuŋɛ.
S.TRANSL: But his daughter had gone to stay in her younger uncle's house.

S.FORM: mɛt'yɛnɛn.
S.TRANSL: She didn't come.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kusannaŋ sen toma mɛghosun.
S.TRANSL: So he didn't get to ask her.

S.FORM: anigɛ yusik kɛrigɛb'ɛn sɛndik kha ottɛ pesaŋ tɔːkkaŋ mɛmbirigɛn.
S.TRANSL: We had arrived in the evening, and it had become night, and it was even dawn, but they didn't even give us rice.

S.FORM: thiaŋ mɛmbirigɛn.
S.TRANSL: They didn't give us beer.

S.FORM: khɔmbha yuŋigɛ.
S.TRANSL: So we just sat there.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ hannɛtmu anigɛ paŋbɔpma thik anigɛ celi — anigɛ nɛ kɛdhama thik yuŋɛ.
S.TRANSL: One of our Pangbopma clan women up there — our cousin-sister lived there.

S.FORM: khɔllɛ thi pirigɛ tɔːk pirigɛ.
S.TRANSL: She gave us beer and rice.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ tɔːk thi pirigɛaŋ — tɔːk thi pirigɛaŋ kɔ thuŋumbɛ cambɛ annupparɛ mɛnniɛ.
S.TRANSL: She gave us rice and beer and we ate and drank without my father-in-law seeing it.

S.FORM: annuppa nisu'llɛ kɔ yammu khan tɔruba əni.
S.TRANSL: If he had seen it he would have abused her.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ nam taːrɛ pe'llɛ kɔ paːnnɛn cɛːtcik tɔŋɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then when the sun came up the affair began to be settled a little.

S.FORM: "ləu! thethe kɛdhaktumaŋ waˀ?" phɛaŋ yammu ɛtyonu kɛbekpahaˀ sərdar —
S.TRANSL: "Well, what all have you brought up?" he asked the party who had gone from down here —

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ "thethe kɛdhaktumaŋ waˀ?" phɛaŋ sen tosusi — napmi sen tosɛ.
S.TRANSL: "What all have you brought up?" he asked us.

S.FORM: sen tosɛ'llɛ kɔ "kɛsan samm'yaŋ ɖhuŋgri thik purumbɛaŋ waˀ.
S.TRANSL: "We've given a gold earring to your daughter.

S.FORM: dui səi yaŋŋaŋ purumbɛaŋ waˀ.
S.TRANSL: And 200 rupees.

S.FORM: tola thik samm'yaŋŋaŋ thaktumbɛaŋ waˀ.
S.TRANSL: And we've brought up a tola of gold,

S.FORM: car səi yaŋ thaktumbɛaŋ waˀ" adzumhaˀrɛ mɛmɛttu.
S.TRANSL: and 400 rupees," my companions said.

S.FORM: mɛmɛttu'llɛ kɔ kappob'ɛllɛ "ləu! atti kɛghosum mɔna?
S.TRANSL: The old man said, "Well, how can you have the girl?

S.FORM: khɛnɛ mɔnan abhebha samm'yaŋ tola thikkɛtmu car səi yaŋŋɛtmu kɛghosummi?"
S.TRANSL: — how can you get her for a tola of gold and 400 rupees?"

S.FORM: pha yammu kappob'ɛn ɔːktɛ.
S.TRANSL: the old man shouted again.

S.FORM: ɔːktɛ'llɛ kɔ kumbhu kun'saˀ mɛd'yɛaŋ "alla kɛdzuːtpa paːnnɛn khɛnɛ yammu theaŋ ciyɔmba paːn kɛdzogu?
S.TRANSL: He shouted, but his brothers came and said, "Now, why are you making such a big thing over an affair that's already settled.

S.FORM: yɔmba paːn cokma mɛːnduk cuːrɛb'ɛn" phɛaŋ yammu kumbhu kun'saˀrɛ annuppa yammu pa mɛmɛttu.
S.TRANSL: It's no good making a big deal over something that's finished," his brothers reasoned with my father-in-law.

S.FORM: pa mɛmɛttuaŋ tɛndɛ.
S.TRANSL: They reasoned with him and he agreed.

S.FORM: tɛndɛ'llɛ kɔ ləu! car səi yaŋnu samm'yaŋ tola thikkɛn nɛssum purumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: Well! So we put down 400 rupees and a tola of gold,

S.FORM: nɛssum purumbɛaŋ tɛmsu.
S.TRANSL: and he took it.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ thihaˀ sahaˀ jəmmə tɛmsuaŋ teˀru.
S.TRANSL: Then he took away all the beer and the meat.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ ləu! anigɛ khɔmbhɛaŋ lɔt thi mɛbirigɛ.
S.TRANSL: Only then did they give us some beer.

S.FORM: thi mɛbirigɛaŋ akkho yammu sɔpmaŋ tɔːkkaŋ mɛbirigɛ.
S.TRANSL: And a bit later they gave us rice.

S.FORM: tɔːk mɛbirigɛaŋ nam taːrɛ pe
S.TRANSL: They gave us rice and it became day,

S.FORM: imma mɛŋghoba.
S.TRANSL: without our getting to sleep.

S.FORM: imma mɛŋghobaŋ kɔ kudaːndiks'ma yammu yapmi mɛsaktɛ annuppasi annupmasirɛ thikyaːn nam thadha yuŋigɛaŋ.
S.TRANSL: Without getting any sleep, the next day they kept us in, my father and mother-in-law, all day long.

S.FORM: yammu kudaːndiks'ma thikyaːn yuŋigɛaŋ paːnnɛn tɔŋɛ cuːrɛaŋ yammu anigɛ ɛtyo nuːksi yɛigɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then the next day, after we'd stayed one day and the affair was completely settled, we came back down here.

S.FORM: yeti nəi sər.
S.TRANSL: That's all, sir.
